versos: (shoot) Isaiah 11:1 - A shoot will come up from the stump of Jesse; from his roots a Branch will bear fruit.;;

(occupied) Luke 19:13 - "So he called ten of his servants and gave them ten minas. Put this money to work, he said, until I come back.";;;
(inclosed) Genesis 7:16 - "And they that went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God had commanded him: and the LORD shut him in.";;;
(band) Ezekiel 13:18 - ", and make veils for the heads of persons of every stature to hunt souls Will you hunt down souls belonging to my people, and keep your own souls alive";;;
(rend) Isaiah 64:1 - "Oh, that You would rend the heavens That You would come down That the mountains might shake at Your presence-";;;

(clothe) Isaiah 61:10 - I delight greatly in the Lord; my soul rejoices in my God. For he has clothed me with garments of salvation and arrayed me in a robe of his righteousness, as a bridegroom adorns his head like a priest, and as a bride adorns herself with her jewels.;;;

(reared) Isaiah 49:21 NIV: Then you will say in your heart,
    Who bore me these
I was bereaved and barren;
    I was exiled and rejected.
    Who brought these up
I was left all alone,
    but thesewhere have they come from;;;

(pigeons) Leviticus 12:8 - "'But if she cannot afford a lamb, she is to bring two doves or two young pigeons, one for a burnt offering and the other for a sin offering. In this way the priest will make atonement for her, and she will be clean.'";;;
(pluck) Matthew 13:30 - Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers
(feathers) Psalm 91:4 - "He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.";;;
(hoglah) Numbers 27:1 - Then the daughters of Zelophehad came forward. The name of his daughter was hoglah
(tirzah) Song of Solomon 6:4 - "You are beautiful as tirzah, my love, lovely as Jerusalem, awesome as an army with banners.";;;
(asunder) Mark 10:9 - "What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.";;;
(handful) Proverbs 27:16 - "If you have found honey, eat only enough for you, lest you have your fill of it and vomit it.";;;
(uttereth) Proverbs 12:17 - "He that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: but a false witness deceit.";;;

(baken) Exodus 12:39 - And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they brought forth out of Egypt, for it was not leavened; because they were thrust out of Egypt, and could not tarry, neither had they prepared for themselves any victual.;;;
